summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20-CR-330). The order denies the defense's motion to prohibit extrajudicial statements by the government and witness counsel, while warning all parties to comply with court rules to protect Maxwell's right to a fair trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20-CR-330) who is the subject of the defense motion seeking to restrict extrajudicial statements.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who issued the order denying the defense's motion and warning all parties to comply with court rules.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against Maxwell and issued this order regarding her motion.

events.title: Court Order on Extrajudicial Statements
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan denied Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to prohibit the government and witness counsel from making extrajudicial statements about the case, while warning all parties to comply with court rules.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The defense moved to prohibit the government and witness counsel from making extrajudicial statements about the case.
Judge Alison J. Nathan denied the motion without prejudice, stating the court expects compliance with existing rules.
The court warned that it would take appropriate action if any relevant rules were violated going forward.
The order emphasizes protecting Ghislaine Maxwell's right to a fair trial by an impartial jury.
This document is part of criminal case 20-CR-330 against Ghislaine Maxwell.
